html: 1.9.21  8:13 am   what do i do i'm bored

1.9.21  7:48 am   One thing that kinda "scares" me whenever I listen to or watch interviews of people I respect for their creativity, is that every time they are asked about how did they become so creative, they all answer that, at some point, struggles and panic drive you. So, my question is, how can you become creative if you don't have any struggles in your everyday life?
1.9.21  7:17 am   How do you feel about repeating questions?
1.9.21  6:56 am   Do you think there are more feelings

1.9.21  6:44 am   hi. im curious. how good are you at replicating or playing back a piece of music perfectly by ear. weather it be on keys, guitars, drums, etc without looking it up online for chords, sheets, etc?

     id figure you're probably the best.
1.9.21  6:41 am   what shape is soup

1.9.21  6:28 am   Bill i just wanted to say your stuff is something I find myself always happy to go back to. There's just something about your style that cuts through my depression, and I just wanted to say thank you for the smiles.

1.9.21  5:37 am   I've recently found that my dreams are incredibly more vivid, striking, emotional, fun and overall more aesthetically compelling than anything in my actual reality. Should I place myself into a perpetual dream state

     and if so how

1.8.21  5:41 pm   The fermi paradox dictates that, while we will never see them, there are most definitely intelligent aliens out there. Do you think that these aliens have music, or something similar to music?

1.8.21  5:30 pm   last night i had a dream that you released a song called "stars exploding" or something like that and it was 11 minutes long, used mostly chords exclusively from the major scale, and was either about or had a major recurring theme of things being the way they are because people changed them. like something is only the way it is because someone either changed it or chose not to change it. There were no jingles or non sequitur lyrics or anything. I don't remember what it sounded like but it was incredible, any thoughts?
